description: This 3M Company report (Q2 2023) details financial performance (including income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow), segment revenue, and significant accounting policies. It extensively addresses ongoing legal proceedings, primarily focusing on PFAS-related environmental litigation, Aearo Technologies' bankruptcy, and other product liability lawsuits. The report also covers restructuring actions, risk factors (economic, legal, and operational), and management's discussion and analysis of the company's financial condition. Finally, it includes the required certifications and disclosures.

This 3M Company 10-K report details financial performance (2021-2022), including sales by segment and geography, operating margins, and cash flow. Significant litigation costs related to PFAS and earplugs are discussed, along with risk factors and critical accounting estimates. The report includes financial statements, auditor's report, management's discussion and analysis, and details on executive compensation and equity plans (stock options, RSUs). Extensive disclosures regarding legal proceedings and compliance are also present.

This 3M Company 2018 Form 10-K report details its business operations, financial performance, and risk factors. It includes management's discussion and analysis, audited financial statements, segment breakdowns of sales and operating income, information on significant accounting estimates, legal proceedings (especially concerning PFAS and asbestos), executive compensation, and corporate governance information. The report also addresses compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley Act requirements and includes certifications from key executives.

This 3M Company 10-K report covers 2015 financial performance and operations. It details business segments (Industrial, Safety & Graphics, Health Care, Electronics & Energy, Consumer), financial statements (income, comprehensive income, balance sheet, cash flow, equity), accounting policies, and risk management. Significant accounting estimates (legal proceedings, pensions, assets) are discussed. The report includes management certifications (Sarbanes-Oxley), auditor's report, and details on stock-based compensation, debt, and pension plans. Finally, it lists subsidiaries and exhibits filed with the SEC.

This 3M Company 10-K report details the company's 2016 financial performance and operational overview. It includes financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, risk factors, legal proceedings, and disclosures on accounting policies and estimates. The report also covers 3M's business segments (Industrial, Safety & Graphics, Health Care, Electronics & Energy, Consumer), geographic performance, and significant accounting estimates. Finally, it includes details of several 3M nonqualified pension plans including eligibility, contributions, and benefit distribution.

This 3M Company 2017 10-K report details the company's financial performance, business segments (Industrial, Safety & Graphics, Healthcare, Electronics & Energy, Consumer), research & development, and risk factors. It includes consolidated financial statements, analyses of sales and operating income by segment and geography, discussions of critical accounting estimates (including legal proceedings and pensions), cash flow information, and disclosures on debt, stock repurchases, and dividends. Executive compensation and corporate governance details are also provided, along with required certifications.

This 3M Company 10-K report details financial performance for 2019, including sales by segment and geography, operating income analysis, and cash flow statements. It covers risk factors, legal proceedings (particularly extensive PFAS litigation), management and governance, accounting policies, and significant accounting estimates. The report also includes consolidated financial statements, auditor's opinion, management certifications (SOX 302 & 906), and descriptions of executive compensation and benefit plans. Finally, it provides detailed information on debt securities and stock-based compensation.

This 3M Company 10-K report details the company's business operations, financial performance (2018-2020), and risk factors. It includes discussion of business segments, financial statements, significant accounting policies, litigation (especially concerning PFAS), executive compensation, and corporate governance. The report also addresses risk factors, including economic conditions and legal proceedings, and provides certifications under Sarbanes-Oxley Act. Financial data includes net sales, income, cash flow, and debt.

This 3M Company 10-K report details the company's fiscal year performance and operations. It covers business segments (Safety & Industrial, Transportation & Electronics, Health Care, Consumer), financial results (GAAP and non-GAAP), risk factors (economic conditions, litigation), accounting policies, and financial statements. Significant legal proceedings, particularly those related to PFAS and earplugs, are extensively discussed. The report also includes information on executive compensation, corporate governance, and the 3M VIP Excess Plan. Finally, it contains the required certifications and exhibits.

This is AES Corporation's 2015 Form 10-K annual report.  It details the company's business operations focusing on generation and utility businesses.  The report includes financial statements, Management's Discussion & Analysis, risk factors (regulatory, environmental, financial), and a significant section detailing a merger agreement.  Key financial metrics, segment performance, and cash flow analyses are provided, along with disclosures on accounting policies and significant events.

This is AES Corporation's 2016 Form 10-K annual report.  It details the company's business operations across various global regions (U.S., Andes, Brazil, MCAC, Europe, Asia), focusing on generation and utility businesses.  The report includes financial statements, Management's Discussion & Analysis, risk factors (regulatory, environmental, financial), and a significant section detailing a merger agreement.  Key financial metrics, segment performance, and cash flow analyses are provided, along with disclosures on accounting policies and significant events.

This is AES Corporation's 10-K annual report, detailing its 2017 performance.  The report covers business operations across various global Strategic Business Units (SBUs), focusing on generation and utility services.  It includes financial statements, Management's Discussion & Analysis, risk factors (high indebtedness, market volatility), and significant accounting policies.  The report also addresses environmental regulations, legal proceedings, and executive compensation, referencing supplementary information in the 2018 Proxy Statement.

This 10-K report for AES Corporation details its 2018 financial performance and operations.  It covers business segments (US Utilities, South America, MCAC, Eurasia), risk factors (financial, operational, regulatory, and environmental), and financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, cash flow).  The report also includes management's discussion and analysis, critical accounting policies, and disclosures regarding debt, commitments, and contingencies.  Significant attention is given to regulatory frameworks and environmental compliance across its global operations.

This document is The AES Corporation's 2019 annual report, detailing its global energy generation and distribution businesses.  It covers the company's business overview, strategic highlights, segment performance (US & Utilities, South America, MCAC, Eurasia), financial statements (including income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow statement), and risk factors.  Significant attention is given to operational details in various countries, regulatory environments, and financial performance analysis, including discussion of  economic challenges and decarbonization initiatives.  The report also includes management's discussion and analysis, accounting policies, and corporate governance information.

This document is The AES Corporation's financial report, covering business overview, operational performance across various global segments (US Utilities, South America, MCAC, Eurasia),  financial statements (including MD&A), and significant risk factors.  It details generation assets, regulatory environments,  strategic initiatives,  financial results, and critical accounting policies for the years 2018-2020.  The report also includes information on executive officers, risk mitigation, and compliance with environmental regulations.

This document is The AES Corporation's 2021 Form 10-K annual report.  It details the company's business operations across diverse global regions, focusing on its generation and utility businesses,  renewable energy initiatives, and strategic acquisitions.  The report includes a comprehensive financial analysis, risk factors, management discussion, consolidated financial statements, and certifications by executive officers.  Significant attention is given to operational details in the Americas, Eurasia, and details on key subsidiaries like AES Indiana and AES Ohio.  A substantial portion covers financial statements, notes, and related disclosures.

This is The AES Corporation's 2022 Form 10-K filing.  It details the company's business operations across various global regions, including the US, South America, and Eurasia, focusing on generation and utility businesses.  The report includes a comprehensive financial analysis, risk factors (operational, regulatory, financial, environmental),  management's discussion and analysis, audited financial statements, and compliance certifications.  Significant subsidiaries and projects and their performance are highlighted, along with executive compensation and corporate governance information.  Numerous exhibits and supplementary data are appended.

This Activision Blizzard, Inc. 10-K report details the company's 2015 performance and financial position.  Key highlights include the King Digital Entertainment acquisition, business segment overviews (Activision, Blizzard, and others),  a comprehensive risk assessment encompassing market competition, regulatory compliance, and technological changes, and consolidated financial statements.  The report also includes management's discussion and analysis, accounting policies, and certifications.  Significant risks detailed include reliance on digital sales, competition, and platform licensors.

This Activision Blizzard 10-K report details the company's 2016 performance and financial status.  It covers business operations across its segments (Activision Publishing, Blizzard Entertainment, King Digital Entertainment),  key products, marketing strategies, competitive landscape, and significant risk factors.  The report includes audited financial statements, management's discussion and analysis,  detailed accounting policies,  information on debt, liquidity, and share-based compensation, as well as various certifications and exhibits, including details of the King acquisition and executive compensation from the proxy statement.

This document is Activision Blizzard, Inc.'s 2017 annual report, covering company overview, acquisition of King Digital Entertainment, business operations, and financial performance.  It details the company's strategic objectives, risk factors (including legal, regulatory, and market risks),  selected financial data, management's discussion and analysis,  consolidated financial statements, and accounting policies.  The report also includes certifications from the CEO and CFO as required by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.

This Activision Blizzard, Inc. 2018 10-K report details the company's business overview, including its three reportable segments (Activision Publishing, Blizzard Entertainment, King Digital Entertainment), products, marketing, and financial results.  Significant discussion focuses on 2018 financial performance, net bookings analysis, and key risk factors such as competition, reliance on key franchises, and regulatory compliance.  The report also includes audited financial statements, notes to the statements, executive compensation details, and various exhibits including employment agreements and incentive plan documents.

This is Activision Blizzard, Inc.'s 10-K annual report, covering financial performance and risk factors for 2019.  The report details the company's business overview, key franchises, executive team, and significant financial data including revenues by segment (Activision, Blizzard, King) and distribution channel.  It also addresses risk factors like competition, regulatory compliance, and cybersecurity.  Significant accounting policies and internal controls are explained, followed by audited financial statements, exhibits, and certifications from the CEO and CFO.  The report includes an employment agreement as an exhibit.

This Activision Blizzard, Inc. Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2020, details the company's financial performance and operational activities.  It covers business segments (Activision Publishing, Blizzard Entertainment, King), key franchises, risks (COVID-19 impact, competition, reliance on key titles), financial statements (including consolidated balance sheets, income statements, and cash flows), critical accounting policies, and executive certifications.  The report also includes notes to financial statements,  exhibits, and disclosures regarding share-based compensation and legal proceedings.

This Activision Blizzard, Inc. 10-K report covers the fiscal year ending December 31, 2021.  It details the company's business overview, including its merger agreement with Microsoft and the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.  The report extensively analyzes financial performance across various segments (Activision, Blizzard, King),  discusses key risks (competition, regulatory, technological), and includes audited financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, and certifications.  Significant sections cover intellectual property, workplace initiatives, and risk factors, along with detailed notes and exhibits, including stock option and restricted share unit award terms.

This is Activision Blizzard's 2022 10-K report, detailing its financial performance, business operations, and risks.  The report covers the company's three segments (Activision Publishing, Blizzard Entertainment, King Digital Entertainment), its pending Microsoft merger,  significant risks (competition, reliance on franchises, legal matters), and detailed financial statements.  It also includes certifications from the CEO and CFO and extensive information regarding a Restricted Share Unit Award, including country-specific appendices.

This document is Activision Blizzard's condensed consolidated financial statements for the second quarter of 2023.  It includes unaudited financial statements (income, cash flow, equity), segment and regional revenue breakdowns (by distribution channel and platform),  key operating metrics (MAUs, net bookings),  management's discussion and analysis,  details on the Microsoft merger,  legal proceedings (including employment-related matters), and disclosures on critical accounting policies and risk factors.  The report also highlights financial performance, including revenue by segment (Activision, Blizzard, King) and key performance indicators.

This Adobe Systems Incorporated 10-K report details the company's fiscal year 2015 performance and business overview.  It covers business segments (Digital Media, Digital Marketing, Print & Publishing), product offerings (Creative Cloud, Document Cloud), competitive landscape, and risk factors.  The report includes comprehensive financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flows), notes to the financials,  management's discussion and analysis, and information on corporate governance and executive compensation.  Forward-looking statements and significant accounting policies are also disclosed.

This Adobe Systems Incorporated 10-K report details the company's fiscal year 2016 performance and financial condition.  It covers business operations across Digital Media, Digital Marketing, and Print & Publishing segments,  analyzes competitive landscapes and risk factors (including subscription model, economic, and legal risks), and presents consolidated financial statements with accompanying notes.  Management's discussion and analysis of financial results are included, along with information on executive compensation, stock ownership, and corporate governance.  The report concludes with exhibits and signatures.

This Adobe Systems Incorporated 10-K report details the company's fiscal year 2017 performance and financial position.  It covers business operations, including product offerings (Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, Experience Cloud) and market competition.  Significant risks, such as security breaches and regulatory changes, are analyzed.  The report presents consolidated financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements, along with management's discussion and analysis.  Key financial metrics, segment performance, and  accounting policies are explained, concluding with  auditor's report and corporate governance information.

This Adobe Inc. 10-K report (fiscal year 2018) details the company's business overview, encompassing its three segments (Digital Media, Digital Experience, Publishing), market analysis, competitive landscape, and key products/services.  It includes a comprehensive financial analysis, covering revenue, expenses, profitability, cash flow, and significant accounting policies.  Risk factors, including security breaches, regulatory concerns, and market volatility, are discussed.  The report also provides information on executive compensation, corporate governance, and financial statements, certified by company officers.

This Adobe Inc. 10-K report covers the fiscal year ending November 29, 2019.  It details the company's business overview, including its Digital Media, Digital Experience, and Publishing segments, strategies, and competitive landscape.  The report includes financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flows), management's discussion and analysis, risk factors, legal proceedings, and information on stock and executive leadership.  Significant accounting policies, including revenue recognition and recent acquisitions, are also explained.  The report is certified by independent auditors.

This Adobe Inc. 10-K report details the company's fiscal year 2020 performance and business overview.  It covers segments (Digital Media, Digital Experience, Publishing & Advertising), competitive landscape,  products/services, marketing, and human capital.  Financial statements, including income, cash flow, and balance sheets, are presented along with management's discussion and analysis.  Significant accounting policies,  risk factors (including COVID-19 impact), legal proceedings, and market risk disclosures are also included.  The report concludes with audit information, internal control evaluations, and exhibits.

This Adobe Inc. 10-K report details the company's fiscal year 2021 performance, focusing on its Digital Media and Digital Experience segments.  It covers business overview, product offerings, market analysis, competition, risk factors (including COVID-19 impact), financial statements, accounting policies, executive compensation, and corporate governance.  Strong revenue growth is highlighted, along with details on acquisitions and  stock repurchase programs.  Consolidated financial statements and auditor's report are included.  Significant risk factors and accounting policies are thoroughly discussed.

This is Adobe Inc.'s Form 10-Q for the quarter ended June 2, 2023.  The report includes condensed consolidated financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flows, and statements of comprehensive income and stockholders' equity), detailed notes explaining accounting policies and significant transactions (including the Figma acquisition), and management's discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations.  It also covers risk factors, legal proceedings, and details on stock repurchases.  The report concludes with signatures and a trademark summary.

This Adobe Inc. 10-K report details the company's fiscal year 2022 performance and operations.  It covers business overview, product offerings (Digital Media & Digital Experience), market analysis, competition, risk factors, financial statements (including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flows), accounting policies, and significant acquisitions (like Figma).  The report also includes information on executive leadership, stock information, and legal matters.  Detailed notes to the financial statements provide further explanation of key accounting policies and figures.

This Amazon.com, Inc. Form 10-K filing details the company's 2015 business operations, financial performance, and risk factors.  It includes a business overview, competitive analysis, risk assessment, management information, financial statements (including consolidated statements of operations, cash flows, and balance sheets), accounting policies, and auditor reports.  Significant segments cover revenue recognition, cost of sales, operating expenses,  and liquidity.  Executive certifications confirm the report's accuracy and compliance.

This is Amazon.com, Inc.'s 2016 Form 10-K report, a comprehensive annual filing.  It details Amazon's business overview, competitive landscape, risk factors, financial performance (including statements of operations, cash flows, and balance sheets), accounting policies, and significant subsidiaries.  The report also includes management's discussion and analysis, auditor's reports, and certifications from key executives.  Key financial data and segment breakdowns (North America, International, AWS) are provided.  Legal proceedings and other relevant disclosures are included.

This is Amazon's 2017 10-K report, detailing its financial performance and business operations.  The report includes business overview, risk factors, financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement), segment information (North America, International, AWS), accounting policies, notes to the financial statements, and auditor's report.  Key executives certify the report's accuracy.  The document also covers competitive landscape, intellectual property, stock information, and significant subsidiaries.

This Amazon 10-K filing details the company's business operations, financial performance (2016-2018), and risk factors.  It covers business segments (North America, International, AWS), competition, intellectual property,  legal proceedings, and financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow).  Significant accounting policies and judgments are explained, along with management's discussion and analysis.  The filing includes certifications from executives regarding financial reporting and compliance.  Finally, it includes details on stock-based compensation and a global restricted stock unit award agreement.

This Amazon.com, Inc. 2019 Form 10-K report details the company's business operations, financial performance, and risk factors.  It includes consolidated financial statements (income statement, balance sheet, cash flow statement), management's discussion and analysis, segment information (North America, International, AWS),  risk factors, legal proceedings, and auditor reports.  The report also covers stock information, accounting policies, and certifications from executives.  The document complies with SEC regulations and includes disclosures on debt,  stockholders' equity, and internal controls.

This document is Amazon.com, Inc.'s 2020 Form 10-K filing.  It details the company's business overview, competitive landscape, risk factors, financial performance (including consolidated statements of operations, cash flows, and balance sheets), segment information (North America, International, AWS), accounting policies, and internal controls.  Significant attention is given to the impact of COVID-19 on operations and financial results.  The filing also includes auditor reports, management certifications, and information on legal proceedings and stock activity.

This document is Amazon.com, Inc.'s 2021 Form 10-K annual report.  It details Amazon's business operations, competitive landscape, risk factors, and financial performance.  Key sections include management's discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations, consolidated financial statements, and segment information.  The report also includes disclosures on intellectual property, human capital, and legal proceedings.  Finally, it contains exhibits, including a significant amended credit agreement with detailed loan terms, conditions, covenants, and default provisions.

This Amazon.com, Inc. Form 10-K report (2022) details the company's business operations, financial performance, and risks.  It covers the company's business segments (North America, International, AWS), competitive landscape,  risk factors, financial statements (including cash flows, income statement, and balance sheet),  accounting policies, executive compensation (referenced in the Proxy Statement), and corporate governance.  The report includes certifications from the CEO and CFO, affirming the accuracy of the information and compliance with SEC regulations.  Significant subsidiaries are also listed.

This Amcor plc Form 10-K report covers fiscal year 2019, detailing the company's business overview post-Bemis acquisition, including its segments and risk factors.  It presents financial results, including consolidated statements of income, cash flows, and balance sheets, along with notes explaining significant accounting policies and judgments.  The report also includes information on executive compensation (deferred), corporate governance, internal controls (with material weaknesses identified), and exhibits such as the code of ethics and auditor consent.

This Amcor plc 10-K report details the company's fiscal year 2020 performance, including financial statements, segment information (Flexibles and Rigid Packaging), risk factors (strategic, operational, financial, legal), and the Bemis Company acquisition.  It discusses accounting policies, critical estimates (pension plans, goodwill),  liquidity, and debt.  Executive compensation and certain other details are deferred to a forthcoming proxy statement.  The report includes auditor opinions and certifications from the CEO and CFO regarding financial statement accuracy and internal controls.  A deferred compensation plan is also described.

Amcor PLC's 2021 Form 10-K provides a comprehensive overview of its business, including its segments (Flexibles and Rigid Packaging), financial performance, and risk factors.  The report details its financial statements, accounting policies, and significant accounting estimates.  It also includes information on executive compensation (deferred to a proxy statement), risk factors, legal proceedings,  shareholder information, and debt obligations, along with the required certifications from the CEO and CFO.  The document extensively covers the Bemis acquisition and its impact on the company's financials.

This document is Amcor plc's 2022 SEC Form 10-K annual report.  It details the company's business overview, including its segments (Flexibles and Rigid Packaging), financial performance (revenues, expenses, cash flow), risk factors, and accounting information.  Significant sections cover the company's financial statements, notes to the financial statements,  liquidity and capital resources, and  risk disclosures.  It also includes information on executive compensation (to be detailed in a future proxy statement), corporate governance, and legal and regulatory compliance.  Finally, it features exhibits and certifications from the CEO and CFO.

This document details Amcor plc's entry into a three-year and a five-year syndicated facility agreement.  It includes the full text of the three-year agreement, outlining definitions of financial terms, borrowing conditions, lender commitments, fees, and default provisions.  The five-year agreement is also summarized, presenting key articles covering definitions, credits, representations, and warranties.  Both agreements specify roles of agents, conditions for effectiveness, and governing law, concluding with numerous signature pages from participating financial institutions.

This Form 8-K filing announces the substitution of Amcor Flexibles North America, Inc. as the issuer under a Second Supplemental Indenture (dated June 30, 2022), replacing a previous entity.  The filing includes the full text of both the Second and First Supplemental Indentures, detailing the agreement between the former and substitute issuers, and a list of related exhibits.  The document confirms the report via authorized signatures.  It primarily details a corporate restructuring event involving debt obligations.

This document details Amcor plc's entry into three-year and five-year syndicated facility agreements.  It includes the agreements' terms and conditions, definitions of key financial and legal terms (e.g., EBITDA, default,  various loan types),  representations and warranties from Amcor,  covenants,  procedures for loan drawdowns, repayments, and defaults, and  signature pages from numerous participating banks.  The document also outlines the roles of administrative agents and addresses regulatory compliance.

This Form 8-K filing by Amcor PLC reports on a significant corporate event: the substitution of Amcor Finance (USA), Inc. for Amcor Flexibles North America, Inc. as the issuer under a Second Supplemental Indenture, detailed in Exhibit 4.6.  The filing includes the full text of both the First and Second Supplemental Indentures, outlining the agreements with Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas.  Additionally, it lists related exhibits and includes the required signatures confirming the report's accuracy.  The core focus is the legal restructuring detailed in the supplemental indentures.

This Form 10-Q report for Amcor plc covers the six months ended December 31, 2022.  It includes unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements (income, comprehensive income, balance sheets, cash flows, and equity), detailed notes explaining key accounting policies and activities (including restructuring, acquisitions, and derivatives), management's discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations, and disclosures about market risk and internal controls.  The report also contains certifications from the CEO and CFO.  Significant events include the sale of the Russian business and acquisitions.

Amcor's fiscal 2023 results announcement details financial performance, including segment breakdowns, net sales, and adjusted EBIT.  The report analyzes volume weakness and provides fiscal 2024 guidance.  Information on cash returns to shareholders (dividends and share repurchases),  net interest and tax expenses, and adjusted free cash flow are included.  The document contains unaudited financial statements (income and cash flow), reconciliations of non-GAAP measures, and a conference call announcement.  Forward-looking statements and a cautionary note are also presented.

Amcor PLC's 2023 Form 10-K annual report details its business overview, including segments (Flexibles and Rigid Packaging),  intellectual property, sustainability initiatives, and risk factors (financial, operational, legal).  It presents financial statements (income, cash flow, balance sheet) and notes, analyzing fiscal year 2023 performance against prior years and discussing key accounting policies and judgments.  Executive compensation, share ownership, and corporate governance information are included, along with certifications by the CEO and CFO.  The report also covers debt obligations, including details on senior notes and guarantees.

This is Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.'s (AMD) 2015 annual report.  It details AMD's business overview, including its product offerings, market position, competitive landscape, and 2015 restructuring plan.  Significant attention is given to risk factors, such as reliance on third-party manufacturers and market cyclicality.  The report includes extensive financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, notes to the financial statements, and information on stock options and other equity compensation plans, along with the required certifications and auditor's report.

This Form 10-K is Advanced Micro Devices' (AMD) annual report, covering business operations, financial performance, and risk factors for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2016.  It details AMD's semiconductor business within the competitive landscape, including market segments, products, sales strategies, and manufacturing.  The report includes audited financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, risk factors (e.g., market conditions, reliance on third parties), and significant accounting estimates.  Further, it contains details on debt agreements, stock options, and restricted stock units, along with executive certifications.

This document is AMD's 2017 Form 10-K annual report.  It details AMD's business operations, including its product offerings (microprocessors, GPUs), market analysis (competition with Intel and Nvidia), and financial performance.  Significant risk factors are identified, along with financial statements, notes, and management's discussion and analysis.  The report also includes information on debt obligations, stock-based compensation, legal proceedings, and details of various agreements and employee stock plans, including extensive country-specific terms and conditions.  Finally, executive certifications regarding financial reporting and internal controls are provided.

This is Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.'s (AMD) 10-K filing for 2018.  The report details AMD's business operations, including market analysis, competitive landscape,  and research & development.  Significant sections cover financial performance (including risk factors and MD&A),  financial statements, notes to the financials,  stock-based compensation plans, and internal controls.  Executive certifications and a list of subsidiaries are also included, with many sections referencing the 2019 Proxy Statement for additional detail.

This is Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.'s annual report (2019), incorporating the 2020 Proxy Statement.  It details AMD's business operations in computing and graphics, including products, markets, competition, and risks.  Significant sections cover financial performance (revenue, income, cash flow), debt obligations, accounting practices, and legal matters (litigation, contingencies). The report includes audited financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, and certifications from the CEO and CFO complying with Sarbanes-Oxley Act requirements.  Corporate governance and stockholder information are also provided.

This is AMD's 2020 Form 10-K filing, detailing its business operations, financial performance, and risk factors.  It covers AMD's semiconductor market position, including its computing and graphics, and enterprise segments.  The report includes a discussion of the pending Xilinx acquisition, significant accounting policies, financial statements, and risk factors such as market competition and supply chain vulnerabilities.  The filing also includes certifications from the CEO and CFO, required by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, and corporate governance information.

This AMD Form 10-K annual report covers fiscal year 2021, detailing business operations, including the pending Xilinx acquisition and product lines (computing, graphics, data center).  It extensively addresses risk factors (COVID-19 impact, market competition, supply chain, legal, and financial risks).  The report includes consolidated financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, and certifications by the CEO and CFO, complying with Sarbanes-Oxley Act requirements.  Significant detail is provided on a wafer supply agreement with GLOBALFOUNDRIES.

This document is Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.'s (AMD) 2022 annual report, encompassing business overview, strategy across key segments (data center, client, gaming, embedded), competitive analysis, risk factors (including COVID-19 impact and supply chain challenges), and detailed financial statements (including notes and auditor's report).  It also includes information on corporate governance, executive compensation, and compliance certifications (SOX and SEC).  The report incorporates data from the 2023 Proxy Statement and lists significant subsidiaries.

AMD's 2022 Annual Report details a transformative year with record revenue driven by strong performance across Data Center, Client, Gaming, and Embedded segments, fueled by the Xilinx acquisition.  The report includes financial highlights, segment overviews,  CEO commentary, sustainability initiatives, risk factors (including those related to acquisitions and supply chain),  consolidated financial statements, notes to the statements, auditor's report, and corporate governance information.  Significant growth and strategic investments are emphasized, along with discussion of market risks and future prospects.

This American Express 10-K filing details the company's 2022 performance and financial position.  It covers business operations, competitive landscape, regulatory environment, risk factors (strategic, legal, credit), and financial statements (income, cash flow, balance sheet).  Significant accounting policies and internal controls are explained.  Extensive notes address credit losses, investments, debt, and shareholder equity.  Executive compensation and governance information are also included, along with auditor reports and certifications.  Appendices detail employee benefit plans.

This Form 10-K is American Water Works Company's annual report.  It details the company's business operations (water supply, wastewater services, market-based businesses),  significant risks (regulatory, environmental, financial),  and 2015 financial performance.  The report includes audited consolidated financial statements, notes, and disclosures regarding accounting policies,  executive compensation, and various stock option and performance-based equity grants.  Significant attention is given to regulatory compliance and the impact of the Freedom Industries chemical spill.

This is American Water Works Company, Inc.'s 2016 Form 10-K annual report.  It details the company's business operations (regulated and market-based), financial performance, and risk factors, including regulatory, environmental, and financial risks.  The report includes consolidated financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, and disclosures on executive compensation, accounting policies, and legal proceedings.  Certifications from the CEO and CFO confirm the report's accuracy and compliance.  A settlement agreement related to a chemical spill is also included as an exhibit.

This is American Water Works Company's 2017 Form 10-K report.  It details the company's business operations, including regulated and market-based water and wastewater services,  capital investments, and regulatory environment.  Significant risk factors are discussed, along with financial results,  accounting policies, and legal proceedings, notably those related to the West Virginia Elk River chemical spill.  The report includes audited financial statements, executive compensation information, and certifications from the CEO and CFO.

This document is American Water Works Company's 2018 Form 10-K report.  It details the company's business operations, including regulated and market-based water and wastewater services,  acquisitions, regulatory environment, and financial performance.  The report includes audited financial statements, notes to the statements,  information on executive compensation, and exhibits such as employment agreements and a nonqualified savings plan.  Significant attention is given to regulatory matters, environmental compliance, and risk factors.

This document is American Water Works Company, Inc.'s 2019 annual report (Form 10-K).  It details the company's business operations (regulated and market-based), regulatory environment, growth strategy (acquisitions),  risks (environmental, regulatory, financial, operational),  and financial performance.  Significant legal proceedings and  ESG initiatives are also discussed.  The report includes audited financial statements,  notes to the statements,  and information on executive compensation, corporate governance, and a detailed pension plan.  Finally, certifications from the CEO and CFO are included.

This is American Water Works Company's 2020 annual report (Form 10-K).  It details the company's business overview, including the sale of a New York subsidiary, water services, and market-based operations.  Significant sections cover sustainability initiatives, risk factors (regulatory, environmental, financial), financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flows), accounting policies, and legal proceedings.  The report also includes certifications from executive officers and the independent auditor.

This American Water Works Company, Inc. (AWW) 2021 10-K report details the company's business overview, including regulated and market-based operations, strategic growth initiatives, and regulatory landscape.  It addresses industry legislation, competition, water management, and ESG principles.  Significant financial data, including results of operations, liquidity, and capital resources, are presented.  The report also discloses risk factors, accounting policies, legal proceedings, and governance information, along with executive compensation details and subsidiary listings.  Finally, auditor reports and certifications are included.

This is American Water Works Company, Inc.'s 2022 annual report (Form 10-K).  It covers financial performance (revenues, expenses, cash flow),  regulatory matters,  risk factors (including legal and environmental), capital investments,  competition,  ESG initiatives (social responsibility, governance, diversity),  employee benefits and compensation, and detailed accounting information.  The report also includes certifications from the CEO and CFO, and various appendices detailing stock grants and a comprehensive pension plan.

Significant accounting policies and risk factors are disclosed.  The report also contains certifications from the CEO and CFO, along with exhibits including a credit agreement amendment and stock unit grant.

This Apple Inc. 10-K report details the company's financial performance and condition for fiscal year 2015. This Apple Inc. Form 10-K report covers the fiscal year ending September 24, 2016.  It details Apple's business operations, including product lines, market analysis, and competitive landscape. The report also addresses corporate governance, legal proceedings, and internal controls, concluding with exhibits and certifications. This Apple Inc. 10-K filing details the company's 2017 financial performance and business operations. The report also includes information on executive compensation, corporate governance, risk factors, legal proceedings, and stock information. This Apple Inc. 10-K report covers the fiscal year ending September 29, 2018.  It details the company's business overview, market position, competitive landscape, and financial performance. The report also addresses accounting policies, share-based compensation, debt, and capital return programs. This Apple Inc. 10-K report covers the fiscal year ending September 28, 2019. Significant accounting policies and risk factors are disclosed, along with information on legal proceedings, executive compensation, and corporate governance.  Consolidated financial statements, auditor opinions, and certifications are included, along with descriptions of Apple's debt securities and employee stock plans.

This Apple Inc. Form 10-K for fiscal year 2020 details the company's financial performance, business overview, and risk factors. The report also covers legal proceedings, corporate governance, and accounting policies, accompanied by auditor reports and certifications. This Apple Inc. Form 10-K report covers the fiscal year ending September 25, 2021. This document is Best Buy Co., Inc.'s financial report, covering business overview, operations, financial performance, and risk factors. This document is Best Buy Co., Inc.'s annual report, covering fiscal year 2022.  It details the company's business operations, including its segments, risks, and financial performance. This document reports Best Buy's Q4 FY23 and FY24 financial results. Best Buy's 10-K report details its fiscal year 2023 performance and financial condition.  It includes business overviews, risk factors (external, strategic, operational, financial), financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flows), and notes to the financials.  The report also covers  environmental and social responsibility, human capital management, executive compensation (referenced from the proxy statement), and corporate governance.  The report is certified by the CEO and CFO, complying with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.

This document is a Form 8-K filing by Best Buy Co., Inc., announcing a new $1.25 billion, five-year senior unsecured revolving credit facility.  It details the agreement's terms, including borrowing, guarantees, covenants (affirmative and negative), events of default, and the roles of the Administrative Agent and lenders.  The filing includes the full credit agreement, defining key terms related to finance, environmental regulations, and loan specifics.  Signatures from Best Buy and participating lenders confirm the agreement.

Best Buy Co., Inc. filed Form 8-K, reporting the retirement of director Thomas L. Millner.  The filing details  Millner's resignation from the Board of Directors and the subsequent appointment of a new Audit Committee Chair.  The document includes standard introductory information and the required signatures confirming its submission.  The core focus is the announcement of a director's departure.

This Form 10-Q report presents a company's financial results for the three and six months ended July 29, 2023. This document reports Best Buy's Q2 FY24 financial results, including revenue, earnings per share, and comparable sales. The report includes condensed consolidated financial statements (earnings, balance sheet, and cash flow) and a reconciliation of GAAP and non-GAAP measures.  A conference call announcement and cautionary statements conclude the report.

This is Square, Inc.'s Form 10-K annual report for the year ended December 31, 2015.  The report details Square's business model, financial performance, risks, and accounting policies.  It includes consolidated financial statements, management's discussion and analysis,  risk factors (covering operational, regulatory, and market risks), and information on executive compensation and corporate governance.  Significant attention is given to revenue breakdown, operating expenses, and cash flow analysis.  The report also includes exhibits, such as the 2015 Employee Stock Purchase Plan and certifications from the CEO and CFO.

This is Square, Inc.'s 10-K filing, a comprehensive annual report.  It details the company's business model, financial performance (including revenue, expenses, and cash flow),  risk factors (operational, financial, and legal), and key operating metrics.  The report includes audited financial statements, notes to the statements, management's discussion and analysis, and certifications from the CEO and CFO.  It also covers corporate governance, executive compensation, and legal proceedings.  Finally, it includes exhibits and employment offer letters.

This Square, Inc. Form 10-K annual report (2017) details the company's business overview, focusing on its payment solutions, hardware, software, and Cash App.  It includes financial statements (2015-2017),  management's discussion and analysis, risk factors (including competitive, regulatory, and operational risks), and significant accounting policies.  The report also covers stock information,  legal proceedings, and certifications from the CEO and CFO, complying with Sarbanes-Oxley Act requirements. This Square, Inc. Form 10-K annual report details the company's business overview, including its products (Cash App, Square Capital), seller base, and competitive landscape.  Significant risk factors are discussed, encompassing operational, market, and financial challenges.  The report presents financial statements (balance sheets, income statements, cash flows) and accompanying notes, along with key operating metrics and management's discussion and analysis. This Form 10-K is Square, Inc.'s annual report for the year ended December 31, 2019.  It details the company's business model (Seller Ecosystem and Cash App), financial performance, risk factors (including regulatory, competitive, and operational risks), and financial statements.  Significant attention is given to risk factors related to Bitcoin, payment networks, and third-party reliance.  The report includes audited financial statements, management's discussion and analysis, and certifications from the CEO and CFO.  Information on executive compensation and corporate governance is deferred to the Proxy Statement.

This Form 10-K is Square, Inc.'s annual report, covering business overview, financial performance, and risk factors.  It details Square's Seller and Cash App ecosystems, COVID-19 impact, competitive landscape, and financial statements (including revenue, expenses, cash flow, and accounting policies).  Significant risk factors discussed include competition, regulatory compliance, and macroeconomic conditions.  The report also includes information on corporate governance, executive compensation, and certifications from the CEO and CFO.

This is Block, Inc.'s (formerly Square) 2021 10-K annual report, covering its financial performance and business operations.  Key sections detail the Square and Cash App ecosystems, risks (including those related to acquisitions like Afterpay, BNPL, and COVID-19), financial statements, and critical accounting policies.  The report also includes information on stock structure, corporate governance, executive compensation, and significant loan agreements, along with various subsidiary and plan details.  Financial highlights, including revenue breakdowns and key operating metrics, are presented alongside audit reports.

Block, Inc.'s 2022 Form 10-K details its business model encompassing Square and Cash App ecosystems.  The report analyzes financial performance, including revenue streams and operating expenses, and discusses key operating metrics.  Significant attention is given to risk factors,  covering operational, economic, regulatory, and market risks, particularly those related to cryptocurrency, BNPL, and financial services regulations.  The document also includes audited financial statements, notes to the statements, management's discussion and analysis, and corporate governance information.  Finally, it contains certifications from the CEO and CFO.

This Form 8-K filing details Block, Inc.'s acquisition of Afterpay Limited.  Key aspects include the completion of the acquisition, issuance of Block stock to Afterpay shareholders, appointment of a new director, and a Fifth Amendment to Block's revolving credit agreement.  The filing also includes a comprehensive Trust Deed governing zero-coupon convertible notes issued by Afterpay, outlining terms, conditions, trustee responsibilities, and events of default.  The document extensively defines terms, details conversion rights, and specifies governing law and jurisdiction.

This is Boeing's 2015 Form 10-K annual report.  It details the company's business segments (Commercial Airplanes, Defense, Space & Security, etc.), financial performance (revenues, earnings, cash flow), risk factors, legal proceedings, and executive compensation.  The report includes audited financial statements, notes to the statements, and disclosures regarding accounting policies, pension plans, and share-based compensation.  It also includes certifications by key executives and a list of exhibits.  A significant portion is dedicated to the Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan.

This Boeing 10-K report details the company's 2016 performance and financial position.  It covers business segments (Commercial Airplanes, Defense, Space & Security, Global Services, Boeing Capital), financial results, and accounting policies.  The report also includes detailed financial statements, risk factors, legal proceedings, and executive compensation information.

This is Boeing's 2017 Form 10-K filing with the SEC. It includes consolidated financial statements, accounting policies, disclosures on executive compensation, and legal proceedings. This Boeing 10-K report details the company's 2018 financial performance and operations across its segments (Commercial Airplanes, Defense, Space & Security, Global Services, Boeing Capital).  It includes business overviews, risk factors, financial statements, segment results, liquidity and capital resources, accounting policies, executive compensation, and auditor reports.  Key financial metrics, backlog information, and details regarding legal proceedings and pension plans are also provided.  The report complies with Securities Exchange Act of 1934 regulations.

This Boeing 10-K report details the company's 2019 financial performance and operations across its commercial airplanes, defense, space & security, global services, and Boeing Capital segments. The report includes financial statements, risk factors,  management's discussion and analysis, and disclosures on accounting policies, executive compensation, and shareholder information.  Auditor opinions and certifications are also included.

Boeing's 2020 Form 10-K details the company's financial performance across its segments (Commercial Airplanes, Defense, Space & Security, Global Services, Boeing Capital), highlighting the impact of the 737 MAX grounding and the COVID-19 pandemic.  The report includes financial statements, risk factors (including legal and regulatory matters),  management's discussion and analysis, significant accounting policies, and auditor reports.  It also addresses  critical audit matters and executive compensation (information deferred to the 2021 Proxy Statement).

This Boeing 10-K report details the company's 2021 performance and financial position.  It covers business segments (Commercial Airplanes, Defense, Space & Security, Global Services, Boeing Capital), significant risks (737 MAX, market conditions, liquidity),  financial results, and accounting policies.  The report also includes detailed financial statements, risk factors, legal proceedings, and executive compensation information.  Finally, it provides a comprehensive description of Boeing's Executive Supplemental Savings Plan.

This is Boeing's 2022 Form 10-K filing with the SEC.  The report details Boeing's business segments (Commercial Airplanes, Defense, Space & Security, Global Services, Boeing Capital), financial performance (including significant losses), operational risks, and legal proceedings.  It also includes detailed financial statements, accounting policies, executive compensation, and a description of Boeing's executive supplemental savings plan, along with auditor opinions and certifications.  The report highlights challenges faced by the company and its financial outlook.
